title: looking for a monospace typeface with different weights
content:
hey all

I'm a student at london college of communication working on a type project. I'm having trouble finding a mono space typeface with a few diffferent weights. If anyone has any ideas it would be a great help.

cheers sullivan
author: sullivan

comments.content:
Also Luc(as) de Groot's Monos. Great quality and there are many to choose from and a variety of weights as well.

This might be a good place to start digging in:

[http://www.lucasfonts.com/index\_neu.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102053325/http:/www.lucasfonts.com/index_neu.html "http://www.lucasfonts.com/index\_neu.html")
One weight (maybe two), but cool in its 10 styles: [Panoptica](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102053325/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=SHT0000027#flont).

Quadraat Sans Mono, designed by Fred Smeijers.  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/search/?q=quadraat+sans+mono&site=d&btnG=Go](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102053325/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=quadraat+sans+mono&site=d&btnG=Go "http://www.fontshop.com/search/?q=quadraat+sans+mono&site=d&btnG=Go")

Notes Mono and Manual Mono by PrimeType (Ole Schäfer).  
 [http://www.primetype.com/faces\_info.php?fid=21](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102053325/http:/www.primetype.com/faces_info.php?fid=21 "http://www.primetype.com/faces\_info.php?fid=21")  
 [http://www.primetype.com/faces\_info.php?fid=6](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102053325/http:/www.primetype.com/faces_info.php?fid=6 "http://www.primetype.com/faces\_info.php?fid=6")
